title: Post Your Preseason Meta Predictions Here, Prepare To Eat Your Words Once It Hits Live
body:
Everyone is having different opinions on the preseason - For example, everyone is saying how bad plants are going to be for the game health, how Shaco and Akali are going to be trash now amongst many other things.

I'm posting this to basically just show how stupid it is to make Meta predictions and pretend like it's definitely going to happen, especially if you do it in the form of angry posts on the boards and then pretend like you never said anything when it turns out to be completely different.

I have been guilty of this myself - when the release of Duskblade was announced, the one we have right now, I made a post on how it was going to be absolutely broken on assassins and how it would be the AD version of what Deathfire Grasp used to be. I think I got more than 100 upvotes on that post.

What actually happened is that for the longest time it didn't make a difference just to turn out to be mostly a marksman item. No one ever talked about it again but I still felt like an idiot.

So I'm going to post my Meta predictions down here and expect some of you guys to do the same. On every patch that will come after the Preseason, I will make a new post with a link that will refer back to this post to see how many of our predictions actually were true and how much of them will turn out to be bullshit.
****
**Penetration Marksmen Are Getting Nerfed:**
Right now some caster marksmen like {{champion:236}} {{champion:202}}  and {{champion:21}}  are building penetration items in the early game, something like {{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} and {{item:3071}}, to enhance their ability damage and synergize with their high AD ratios. Since Youmuu's also gives attack speed and it helps an absolute ton in the early game since armor values are really low and the penetration build makes those diminishing return matter, these builds are outclassing early crit investment for these specific champions. They still invest in crit later on though, since that is still the best option for the late game, when the enemy has stacked enough armor through levels and items to negate the power of the early penetration investment.

With the upcoming changes, Youmuu's will lose out on its attack speed which matters more on marksmen than it does on assassins like {{champion:238}}  or {{champion:91}}  who never really made much use of it anyway. On top of that, the penetration marksmen now lose their early game snowballing and killing power that the old flat penetration items gave them, since the new lethality stat scales with the enemy level instead of giving you a high flat value. The new Duskblade is pretty shitty for all the caster marksmen since they don't have any special stealth interactions. They also don't make as much use of the extra out of combat movement speed as melee champions and assassins do, who spend much more time roaming and chasing to land a kill.

There's still the Essence Reaver build as an alternative and the new lethality items might still be better than I'm expecting them to be, so maybe this won't make that much of a difference. We will have to wait and see.
****
**On-Hit Champions Are Getting Nerfed:**
With Guinsoo's and the old Kog being gone, on-hit has been pretty meh over the last few patches. I think it will become even more rough for them with the Fervor of Battle rework, now it will grant you AD per stack instead of extra on-hit damage. For champions who don't really have that much alternative keystones to pick, like {{champion:10}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:24}}  etc., this just seems like a straight out nerf, a pretty big one at that. A lot of champions can make better use of the new Fervor but for the champions I listed above, I predict that they are going to struggle a bit ( except for maybe Kayle, with everyone probably playing assassins in the preseason ).
****
**{{champion:6}}  Will Be Insane:**
Urgot has always been really good when assassins were good, since he has always been hard to kill with his shield and the damage reduction on his ult and passive, combined with the ultimate that is able to immidiately shut down an assassin after he/she tries to kill someone. Not only that, his itemization is also getting a pretty huge buff - {{item:3110}}  gold cost gets lowered, {{item:3156}}  now gives CDR and extra AD when the shield pops and all the new lethality items like reworked {{item:3142}} and Edge of Night also seem pretty good on him since he always was a champion that builds a lot of penetration and prefers the mid-to lategame over the early game.

It'll be super hard to see if anything actually happens with him since there are only are a very few amount of people playing him and nobody really cares about him. Information on whether he is good or not will be super hard to gather. But with all the stuff happening that I just mentioned I can't see how he wouldn't become a god.
****
Let me know what you guys think and post your own predicitions below.

replies.body: i predict ADCs will be played in bot lane every game
{{champion:44}} + {{champion:122}} will be the new meta of bot lane, i can feel it... mostly because I will be playing it.

{{champion:107}}  (500 AD minimally) >:D

Srsly hope riot realize bonetooth isn't the answer, I havn't seen even ONCE since release where rengar isn't broken  or held back by it... If only they'd just give him something similiar to kha, would still fit his hunter theme and be far more fun/balanceable.

You're right. We, the players, never, EVER, anticipate how the changes will affect the game with any degree of accuracy at all. We never get it right. Not ever.

I definitely didn't post this: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/9H4KqONg-please-for-the-love-of-god-bring-back-stealth-wards-in-the-shop . And we definitely didn't suffer through an entire season of snowbally as fuck games largely because of the removal of so much vision. The jungle changes being made this preseason DEFINITELY aren't targeted at reducing the early effectiveness of junglers in order to combat the problematic amount of influence they were allowed to have in games for all of season 6 because of the removal of the primary tools to combat that effectiveness.
My prediction: A full AD Wukong will do anything one of the new assassins do, but better.
I see your full AD Wukong and raze you a Full AD Vi and Full AD J4

That's it, this has gotten out of hand. I'm playing on hit hybrid Urgot now to show you both the errors of your ways.
Diana is gonna replace all of the assassins except Kha'zix and Rengar. We will be seeing her take courage of the collossus as well for an insane shield on her when she uses her E.

Jax is going to be just fine with Courage of the Colossus. It gives him a real weapon.

You're forgetting that farming junglers are getting nerfed! Xypherous himself said "we are suppressing power farming in the jungle".

That means champions who typically have bad ganks **and** bad laning, like Shyvana and Master Yi, are going to disappear completely. And that is exactly what Riot wants.

And don't say "wait for the rework". Riot already gave Master Yi a sweet rework that did absolute jack shit to improve his ability to lane.
Does CoC have a cooldown?
30 seconds.

Just something to note on, but penetration marksmen were an abomination that should never have existed in the first place, and was solely due to the fact that someone figured out you could abuse ranged flat armor pen/armorshred far easier than a melee attacker can.
So that abusive playstyle needed to be gutted.

> [{quoted}](name=nep2une,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=loXhPTRg,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-11-03T21:17:45.323+0000)
>
> Just something to note on, but penetration marksmen were an abomination that should never have existed in the first place, and was solely due to the fact that someone figured out you could abuse ranged flat armor pen/armorshred far easier than a melee attacker can.
> So that abusive playstyle needed to be gutted.

I wouldn't actually call it gutted, And Damage oriented AD caster, can still benefit from Lethality in the same way. With the only difference being that it's not as Snowbally as it use to be. The only other changes is the slight increase in Assassin esk utility, which (maybe, maybe not) appeal to ADCS.

And seeing as those champs had ER well before the Korean build, I doubt that gutting the itemization will totally ruin the champion. 

If anything is going to affect ADCs, it's going to be the Assassins themselves. If we saw an influx of Assassins, the ADC meta might shift to safer, mobile ADCs.
Rest in peace Akali.

> [{quoted}](name=The 1st Angel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=loXhPTRg,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-11-03T21:57:36.900+0000)

This.

zac, vi, sion and sej are goong to be seen in the jgl alot more (maby tank ivern too)

will edit as i think of more

Zed bot is nowhere near as good as talon/kat/rengar/LB(order from best to last on who can impact early and stay relevant late game, rengar has slight issues early since you need level 3 and LB can fall off due to cook time, while talon does need level 2 he isn't weak at all level 1).
i was thinking that cuz thats where he can be closer to the enemy adc and he has back up

Assassins are going to be EVERYWHERE for the first week, as always with these updates.

I wonder if I should polish of my Malphite...
i actually dont mind having an assassin with me when i play adc, i farm minions while the assassin farms champs

{{champion:240}} **Kled Will Rise into Common Play**
Kled's changes make remounting a ton easier to do since the delayed has been more than halved (the time it takes Skaarl to run to you). It only comes at an extremely small damage cost (2% max health damage on W at max rank). Kled is also actually one of the few current Fervor uses that benefits from the changes to it. While his W volley of attacks won't deal as much damage (maybe), the AD from Fervor goes to INCREDIBLE use on his Q, his W final hit, and E. His bonus AD ratios are insane, and this change really goes well with that strength. This allows Kled to build tankier since he doesn't need as much AD as before to make his Q and W deal major damage.
On the other hand, Kled has Edge of Night now if he wants go full offensive, incredibly boosting his defensive properties with it. Ever tried to engage as Kled only to get hit by a Morgana Q or something similar? Not anymore.
Of course, this entire prediction runs on the hope that people will try out listed changes and try and see who is successful AND that Kled's success is broadcast to the public. We will have to see.

--------------------------------------------------

{{champion:6}} **Urgot's (And Other Anti-Assassins') Win Rate Rockets**
If Assassin's are rampant, there is no reason one of the main Anti-Assassins of this game won't rise to power. While I can't guarantee his popularity, those that do play him will see incredible success as, without a doubt, at least one of the Assassins released will be over the edge (slightly or a lot) as far as balance and Urgot will be among the champions that rise to stop them. Plus, even if the Assassin Update is completely balanced, Urgot will still see success as people without a doubt want to try the new Assassins, meaning a near guarantee of 1-2 Assassins per game (maybe even 3).

---------------------------------------------------------

{{champion:1}} **Annie Will Have to Be Kept an Eye On**
With Assassins across the board having their burst become less instant, Annie shines as a champion that still has incredibly strong and quick burst. When you combine that with her E's % damage reduction to make the stream of Assassins less harmful for her, she is someone who will have to be watched carefully because she might just explode into the meta. While her range is limiting and she relies on sneaking into the enemy team, she still offers some major burst and Tibber's Revenge even offers some incredibly follow up damage that can be incredibly boosted if the target is slowed by Rylai's. Annie seems to be someone who can replace the Assassins' previous role of instantly killing targets that NEED to be instantly killed.

-------------------------------------------------

_Post-Rylai's Changes/Nerfs_
{{champion:34}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} **Long Range/Control Mages Return**
When Rylai's is nerfed/changed, it's abuse users will likely (hopefully) fall off from the meta a bit. For at least a little bit, people will be looking for some champions who have burst and still provide some equivalent control over a fight. Long range Mages and Control Mages will answer the call. Artillery and Control Mages offer some good zoning and control over team fights that teams will love. Plus, they are some of the best Mages when dealing with Assassins, especially Control Mages.

Mages can't deal with the midlane assassins because they are building 3 magic resists swords of lalala can't touch this i got too many shields and lifesteal and im fisting your armor

So mages migrate to toplane cos they still want xp and it's easier to beat on tanks and juggernauts

So assassins are now going into the jungle and keep raping mages in toplane but somehow cannot seem to kill the botlane carries who somehow have managed to stack up anywhere between 45-60% damage reduction and a lot of lifesteal and are now actually more tanky then tanks are.

Their supports are also tanks or ranged peel carries and are stacking sustain & shielding to help with knightsvow and to shield their carry who now is an extreme burst dps supertank with a peel & cc slave

And assassin's core theme kill that nasty glasscannon no longer exist because mages have figured out stacking frozen hearth with health ap items and ninjatabi & zhonya's + Redsmite runic echo is the way to go and since they already got that smite they might as well stick to jungling.

So now toplane is a mess because its either extreme mobility skirmnishers and assassins and ranged % reduction stacking carries allover the place all trying to splitpush.
Tanks have nothing to seek up there anymore because everyone as always is completely ignoring their armor with either pen stacking or true damage or % dmg and usually combinations of those, the pesky bugegrs also have too much mobility anyway so you can never fight them on your terms so midlane has become tank vs tank.

A new meta has now formed

And they are adc's so they either have way more range or way more mobility then you do quite often both

So try and win before 15 minutes or you are in for the lamest experience in gaming history

> **Penetration Marksmen Are Getting Nerfed:**

Second that, and here is another reason:

{{item:3147}} is losing its in-fight movement speed boost. In addition, the passive is rather useless for ADCs now, even for Vayne - as a Vayne that is not attacking for 1 second is losing more damage than the proc gets her.

Not attacking for 1 second means you can reposition, it's actually a BUFF that rewards moments of safety. Not to mention the most important thing, it's pretty dam RELIABLE unlike a jungle item(sated0  or a costly item with a useless stat(rageblade) it gives vayne the stats she'd like not to mention disabling traps and warding(when it simple granting vision for them it was nice, but now it's retardedly strong vision passive).

So it's wrong to think vayne won't abuse duskblade, unless they nerf duskblade to need 1.01 second of unseen or nerf vayne to 0.99 seconds of stealth she can abuse it since nothing is wasted and it'll be reliable since good vayne will occasionally reposition several times during ulti.
My prediction: Tank Morgana will make a resurgence with the additions of Courage of the Colossus and Redemption.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/IuQHwadE-the-damage-reduction-from-knights-vow-and-phantom-dancer-need-to-not-stack

I'm seriously calling this one.
is that going to make yasuopport a thing?  he already has one of the most supporty abilities in the game
{{champion:127}} {{summoner:3}}  Is going to be very common, and assassins will actually not be all that popular and'll just bring the rebirth of the hyper control aoe CC meta.
Dumb idea, they're going to release a few new items that's going to alter how builds are streamlined and that's about it. But we may see more adcs topside if assassin items mesh well with their kits.
{{item:3174}} will be much more common on mage supports once {{item:3105}} is not a must buy in nearly every game.

My Predictions:

{{champion:67}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:105}} will all become broken and will need to be perma banned every game. Riot will panic and over buff {{champion:91}} {{champion:55}} when people just needed more time to figure them out, Resulting in them being pick ban for months and eating nerfs every other patch. {{champion:236}} will probably need a buff or 2 because his win rate is kinda crap already and hes losing his top build. {{champion:238}} will become a top laner and be incredibly annoying to deal with while almost entirely leaving the mid lane. In order to kill him, {{champion:85}} will be a good top lane counter, and some strange shit like {{champion:268}} ADC (APC) will be tried to make it so Zed can get almost nothing from his ult change He will be joined by AP {{champion:35}} who will probably need nerfs to AP and buffs to AD. {{champion:84}} is actually going to be just fine, as long as you are playing Tank Akali. AP akali is gone. Tank {{champion:245}} is coming back some time this season as well, probably when the Vanguards get their update and he can abuse a good chunk of their items, but i wont get into that much more because it doesn't relate to the preseason much.  People will probably try to give Tank Ekko its last stand with COTC but wont be able to do it as well. {{champion:7}} will have her clone spawn range nerfed hard, cant say much else but im biased towards her now because i want to add her and Talon to my champion pool. Tank Supports and Junglers will be the meta for their respective roles, Assassin junglers will split play with tank junglers, while mage supports are just thrown out of the meta. As a result of this, {{champion:48}} Support will be a good pick again and {{champion:223}} will be around to deal with the asassins. COTC will break {{champion:89}} {{champion:154}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:12}}. Players will try to find new champions who can be what the old assassins used to be and who can 1 shot with little to no counterplay. They will go to {{champion:59}}, who will end up being in every game for a while. He'll probably be nerfed so hard that it kills tank Jarvan as well. Other things that will wind up as new mid lane assassins. {{champion:58}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:80}} but wont really work that well. {{champion:157}} will still be a massive pain in the ass and once 10 bans come he wont really exist anymore. {{champion:51}} will be th best ADC, as she not only counters Vayne,but she will be brought mid for a short time because of how she can push in assassins and bully them in lane, and because of how broken her sieging is, and she probably wont take any nerfs for it.

Almost none of this will probably actually happen though XD

Fizz is balanced now though and you can tell when he's at a point of power and beat it....

Vayne unless she gets her stealth nerfed by .01 second or duskblade nerfed to 1.01 second of unseen she's going to break it.

Rengar, bonetooth wasn't removed, bonetooth ALWAYS ruins rengar ever since release.... But nope let's keep it instead of giving rengar something similar to kha which would still fit his hunter's theme because hunters want to improve their skills for the next hunt. Nope, let's not make another fun mechanic that you can change varying on matches which people said was fun about kha. (I'm pretty salty about this as you can tell, I actually love the rengar kit changes but holy crap is bonetooth going to ruin him and get him nerfed)

Talon and kat are perfect idk why you think a buff would happen, talon's undoubtedly the strongest non-broken assassin <3. Kat would be the strongest assassin but you need time to actually learn her, but she CAN outdo the rest if punish well enough I love facing her now though, she can still kill fast but you can counter it reasonably.

Lucian like lee is just overused, so their win rates aren't really correct for every 5% play rate after the first 10% should be a -1% to min and max winrate. So at 10% should be 48-52%, 15% 47-51%, 20% 46-50% etc. But that's just rough estimation.

Zed wouldn't become a top laner, he's still the same but actually gained a buff vs AD champs, he IS however nerfed if the enemy lack AD and have an on-hit type adc which will decline when S7 starts cause fervor's change. Overall it's making zed require a bit more skill and giving him a comeback tool if lucky, not to mention no one maxed W early anyways.

AP shaco still has great counterplay(ignoring the shxtty new buff they gave duskblade to actually DISABLE traps, but aside from that ap shaco still has counterplay as long as you're smart and don't act like you can't change your build in a different game). Also AD-wise he'll probably just get a 30-50 damage buff, he really didn't lose too much damage, only real kicker is you HAVE to put 2 points into Q, I feel the rank 1 stealth is far too low to work with. but you get 2 points in Q before level 6 then max E as normal.

Akali, I actually need to try she's the only assassin I havn't tested fully, just wish her passive gave her an AS bonus when in effect cause feels clunky now that you have to weave in AAs a lot more than better.

Tank ekko can't comeback they removed some cc, and assassin ekko is just fine cause it's like LB's silence, the damage is still there. (Although I'm still sad ekko's stun wasn't removed, it sure as hell isn't unreliable since even if you don't land it, it's a huge zoning tool. And it sure isn't an ultimate CD like fizz's hard CC. However because they did listen to a prior suggestion of removing 1 of his 3 slows I'll check how this goes). However a bruiser ekko could pop up since courage is pretty cool, but overall I feel mainly going to see assassin.


Nah LB's clone does not grant assist which is already a huge blow, I can see it's range being the same. If anything her cook time might scale per level down the line to help her late and end game.

The fact you didn't add naut to the courage list, (CC intensifies.) Also you should have added knight's vow to that section too.

J4 doesn't really need anything major to fix assassin, just nerf his ulti base and ratio but let it apply grounded that would fully shift him from assassin back to his tank. If it's still being used his Q's damage could be lower however deals more when hitting a flag(this portion wouldn't scale by AD). Tbh this would just be a rework O_o

Lee actually could work due to lethality and unlike wukong/pantheon he doesn't have a skill that takes while to complete.

I don't really see cait out performing twitch tbh, but twitch is hard to play cause mispositioning so I'll side with you and cait for now.
Katarina and Leblanc seem to have swapped Skill Caps, so I think Kat will be set to replace her as the mid-game snowballing dickwad that Leblanc was
Mages will still be strong as fuck and Assassins will still be useless because they cant do anything for their team.
